canonical_explanation.text: Length tells us how long something is. Height tells us how tall something is. We can compare objects to see which is longer or shorter, taller or shorter. We can also measure length using things like hand spans, footsteps, or pencil lengths. These are called non-standard units.
rules: Longer means more length; shorter means less length.
Taller means more height; shorter means less height.
We compare by placing objects side by side or end to end.
We can measure using hand spans, footsteps, or other objects.
We can order objects from shortest to longest or tallest to shortest.

questions.question_text: Which is longer: a pencil or a crayon?
questions.explanation_correct: Usually a pencil is longer than a crayon.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A pencil is generally longer than a crayon when we compare them side by side.

questions.question_text: Which is shorter: a ruler or a train?
questions.explanation_correct: A ruler is much shorter than a train.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A ruler is about 30 cm long, while a train is very very long. So a ruler is shorter.

questions.question_text: Which is taller: a tree or a flower?
questions.explanation_correct: A tree is taller than a flower.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Trees grow much taller than flowers. A tree is taller.

questions.question_text: Which is shorter in height: a cat or a giraffe?
questions.explanation_correct: A cat is much shorter than a giraffe.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A giraffe is the tallest animal, much taller than a cat. So a cat is shorter.

questions.question_text: A bus is longer than a bicycle.
questions.explanation_correct: True. A bus is much longer than a bicycle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. A bus is much longer than a bicycle.

questions.question_text: An ant is taller than a dog.
questions.explanation_correct: False. An ant is much, much shorter than a dog.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is false. An ant is tiny and a dog is much taller.

questions.question_text: Aarav measured a table with his hand span. He counted 6 hand spans. Diya measured the same table and counted 7 hand spans. Why did they get different numbers?

options.text: Their hand spans are different sizes

questions.explanation_correct: They got different numbers because their hand spans are different sizes. Aarav's hand span is bigger.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Different people have different hand sizes. Aarav's hand span is larger, so he needed fewer spans.

questions.question_text: Which of these can be used to measure length?
questions.explanation_correct: A hand span can be used to measure length. A cup measures capacity, a scale measures weight, and a clock measures time.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Hand span is used to measure length. Cups measure volume, scales measure weight, clocks measure time.

questions.question_text: Which of these can you use to measure the length of a room?
questions.explanation_correct: Footsteps can measure the length of a room. Walk from one end to the other and count your steps.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Footsteps measure length. Spoons and glasses measure capacity, minutes measure time.

questions.question_text: Priya's ribbon is 5 hand spans long. Meera's ribbon is 3 hand spans long. Whose ribbon is longer?
questions.explanation_correct: Priya's ribbon is longer because 5 hand spans is more than 3 hand spans.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 5 hand spans > 3 hand spans. Priya's ribbon is longer.

questions.question_text: Three children stand in a line. Ravi is taller than Sita. Sita is taller than Amit. Who is the tallest?
questions.explanation_correct: Ravi is the tallest. Ravi > Sita > Amit.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Ravi is taller than Sita, and Sita is taller than Amit. So Ravi is the tallest.

questions.question_text: A pencil is 4 hand spans long, an eraser is 1 hand span long, and a book is 3 hand spans long. Arrange from shortest to longest.
questions.explanation_correct: From shortest to longest: eraser (1), book (3), pencil (4).
questions.explanation_incorrect: 1 < 3 < 4. So: eraser (shortest), book, pencil (longest).

questions.question_text: Which is longer: a snake or a worm?
questions.explanation_correct: A snake is longer than a worm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Snakes are much longer than worms.

questions.question_text: Neha is as tall as Kabir. What can we say?
questions.explanation_correct: If Neha is as tall as Kabir, they have the same height.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 'As tall as' means they are the same height.

questions.question_text: Rohan measured a desk using pencils. It was 4 pencils long. What did Rohan use to measure?
questions.explanation_correct: Rohan placed pencils end to end to measure the desk. This is a non-standard way to measure length.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rohan used pencils as a non-standard unit of measurement, placing them end to end.

questions.question_text: Which is shorter: your arm or your finger?
questions.explanation_correct: A finger is shorter than an arm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Your finger is much shorter than your arm.

questions.question_text: In a garden, there is a sunflower and a rose plant. The sunflower is taller. Which plant will you see first from far away?
questions.explanation_correct: The sunflower is taller, so you would see it first from far away.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Taller things are easier to see from far away. The sunflower would be seen first.

questions.question_text: Order from tallest to shortest: building, person, chair
questions.explanation_correct: From tallest to shortest: building, person, chair.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A building is the tallest, a person is next, and a chair is the shortest.

questions.question_text: A shoe is longer than a matchstick.
questions.explanation_correct: True. A shoe is longer than a matchstick.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. A shoe is much longer than a small matchstick.

questions.question_text: A pen is longer than a road.
questions.explanation_correct: False. A road is much, much longer than a pen.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is false. A road is very long. A pen is very short compared to a road.

questions.question_text: Sneha measured a table with her footsteps and got 5 steps. Her baby brother measured the same table and got 8 steps. Why?
questions.explanation_correct: The baby's footsteps are smaller, so he needed more steps to cover the same length.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Smaller feet need more steps to cover the same distance. The baby's feet are smaller.

questions.question_text: Which is taller: a table or a cupboard?
questions.explanation_correct: Usually a cupboard is taller than a table.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cupboard is generally taller than a dining table.

questions.question_text: A rope is 8 pencils long. A ribbon is 5 pencils long. A thread is 3 pencils long. Which is the longest?
questions.explanation_correct: The rope is 8 pencils long, which is the most. It is the longest.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 8 > 5 > 3. The rope (8 pencils) is the longest.

questions.question_text: Which is shorter: a broom or a toothbrush?
questions.explanation_correct: A toothbrush is shorter than a broom.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A toothbrush is small and fits in your hand. A broom is much longer.

questions.question_text: Kavya measured her book using paper clips. She used 6 paper clips. The book is ____ paper clips long.
questions.explanation_correct: The book is 6 paper clips long.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Kavya placed 6 paper clips end to end along the book. So the book is 6 paper clips long.

questions.question_text: Arun is taller than Vihaan but shorter than his father. Who is the shortest?
questions.explanation_correct: Vihaan is the shortest. Father > Arun > Vihaan.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Father is tallest, then Arun, then Vihaan. So Vihaan is the shortest.

questions.question_text: Which is longer: a river or a swimming pool?
questions.explanation_correct: A river is much longer than a swimming pool.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rivers can be hundreds of kilometres long. A swimming pool is just a few metres.

questions.question_text: A coconut tree, a tulsi plant, and a marigold plant are in a garden. Order them from shortest to tallest.
questions.explanation_correct: From shortest to tallest: marigold (small flower), tulsi (medium bush), coconut tree (tall tree).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Marigold is the smallest, tulsi is a small bush, and coconut tree is very tall.

questions.question_text: We can use footsteps to measure the length of a classroom.
questions.explanation_correct: True. Footsteps can be used as a non-standard unit to measure the length of a room.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. We walk from one end to the other and count our steps.

questions.question_text: Sanya's skipping rope is 9 hand spans. Tara's is 6 hand spans. How much longer is Sanya's rope?
questions.explanation_correct: 9 - 6 = 3. Sanya's rope is 3 hand spans longer.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 9 hand spans - 6 hand spans = 3 hand spans longer.

questions.question_text: Which is taller: a lamp post or a bench?
questions.explanation_correct: A lamp post is much taller than a bench.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Lamp posts are very tall, while benches are quite low. A lamp post is taller.

questions.question_text: A cricket bat is shorter than a safety pin.
questions.explanation_correct: False. A cricket bat is much longer than a safety pin.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is false. A cricket bat is about 1 metre long, much longer than a tiny safety pin.

questions.question_text: Order from longest to shortest: a train, a car, a bicycle
questions.explanation_correct: From longest to shortest: train, car, bicycle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A train is the longest, then a car, then a bicycle.

questions.question_text: Aarav measured a table using erasers. It was 10 erasers long. Diya measured the same table using big books. It was 3 books long. Why are the numbers different?
questions.explanation_correct: Erasers are smaller, so you need more of them. Books are bigger, so you need fewer.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Smaller units need more to cover the same length. Erasers are small, so 10 are needed. Books are big, so only 3 are needed.

questions.question_text: Which is shorter in height: a glass or a bottle?
questions.explanation_correct: Usually a glass is shorter than a bottle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Most bottles are taller than glasses. A glass is shorter.

questions.question_text: Which is longer: an elephant's trunk or a mouse's tail?
questions.explanation_correct: An elephant's trunk is much longer than a mouse's tiny tail.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An elephant's trunk can be over a metre long. A mouse's tail is just a few centimetres.

questions.question_text: Three ribbons: Red is 7 clips long, Blue is 4 clips long, Green is 9 clips long. Which is the shortest?
questions.explanation_correct: Blue (4 clips) is the shortest.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 4 < 7 < 9. Blue ribbon at 4 clips is the shortest.

questions.question_text: Which is a good way to measure the length of a blackboard?

options.text: Using dusters placed end to end
Counting the chalk pieces in a box

questions.explanation_correct: Placing dusters end to end along the blackboard measures its length.
questions.explanation_incorrect: To measure length, we place objects end to end. Dusters placed in a line measure the blackboard's length.

questions.question_text: A two-storey building is taller than a single-storey house.
questions.explanation_correct: True. More storeys mean more height. A two-storey building is taller.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Two floors are taller than one floor.

questions.question_text: Kavya's dupatta is 8 hand spans long and Sita's dupatta is 8 hand spans long. What can we say?
questions.explanation_correct: Both are 8 hand spans, so they are the same length.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 8 hand spans = 8 hand spans. They are equal in length.

questions.question_text: Arrange from shortest to tallest: elephant, rabbit, horse
questions.explanation_correct: From shortest to tallest: rabbit, horse, elephant.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A rabbit is the shortest, a horse is taller, and an elephant is the tallest.

questions.question_text: Isha measured the classroom floor by walking from one wall to the other. She took 20 footsteps. The classroom is ____ footsteps long.
questions.explanation_correct: The classroom is 20 footsteps long.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Isha counted 20 steps. So the classroom is 20 footsteps long.

questions.question_text: Which of these is the longest?
questions.explanation_correct: A bedsheet is the longest among these objects.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A bedsheet is much larger than a key, earring, or button.

questions.question_text: Look at these: a mango tree, a curry leaf plant, a coconut palm. Which is the shortest?
questions.explanation_correct: A curry leaf plant is much shorter than both the mango tree and the coconut palm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Curry leaf plants are small bushes. Mango trees and coconut palms grow very tall.

questions.question_text: If we use smaller units to measure, we get a bigger number.
questions.explanation_correct: True. Smaller units mean more are needed. For example, a table might be 10 erasers but only 3 books long.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. You need more small things to cover the same length.

questions.question_text: Arjun's kite string is 7 hand spans. Dev's kite string is 9 hand spans. Whose string is shorter?
questions.explanation_correct: Arjun's string is shorter. 7 hand spans < 9 hand spans.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 7 < 9, so Arjun's string (7 hand spans) is shorter than Dev's (9 hand spans).

questions.question_text: Four objects: pencil (5 clips), eraser (2 clips), notebook (8 clips), pen (4 clips). Arrange from longest to shortest.
questions.explanation_correct: From longest: notebook (8), pencil (5), pen (4), eraser (2).
questions.explanation_incorrect: 8 > 5 > 4 > 2. Order: notebook, pencil, pen, eraser.

questions.question_text: A door is taller than a window.
questions.explanation_correct: True. Usually a door is taller than a window.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Doors are generally taller than windows.

questions.question_text: Which unit would you use to measure the length of a classroom?
questions.explanation_correct: Footsteps are best for measuring a large space like a classroom. Paper clips and rice grains are too small.
questions.explanation_incorrect: For a big space like a classroom, use bigger units like footsteps. Paper clips and rice grains are too tiny.

questions.question_text: A saree is about 6 metres long. A handkerchief is less than 1 metre. Which is longer?
questions.explanation_correct: The saree is much longer than a handkerchief.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 6 metres is much more than less than 1 metre. The saree is longer.
